ratings.comment: Professor gives outlines to help accompany lecture, however, frequently doesn't go over the material in the outlines because "it is explained well in the book." Tests are EXTREMELY specific. Grading is based on how well other students answered the questions. Participation is graded on a curve- you won't get full points unless you talk every class.

A really great lecturer and very detailed in what you do/don't need to know for exams, I only wish she had given more interactive assignments than just textbook readings to make the class more engaging
class very well organized. she is very clear about what you should/shouldn't know, emphasizes key points
Maria was awesome! She was clearly prepared for every class and gave great feedback. She gives a great overview of retail management. She is such a gem, very very nice!
Professor Heide is the sweetest, most understanding professor I've had in college. She was approachable, and created a great teaching environment.
Super organized, really knowledgeable. The professor was so smart and really accommodating to students.
Professor M Heide is the most enthusiastic teacher I have ever had, which made the course much easier to pay attention and get excited about retail in marketing
Maria is very helpful towards students and really cares about her students. She is available outside of the class to speak with students and help them moving forward.

Very organized course. I knew exactly what I was going to be doing each class period. Maria speaks very clearly for students to understand. And I gained a great understanding of a general overview of the retail industry. Maria rocks!

This is the WORST marketing class I've ever taken at UW. Maria's exams are ridiculously specific and hard, and she is the most meticulous grader I've ever experienced. The class is organized terribly, lectures are based on if other students did the reading, so if no one participates Maria refuses to teach anything. AVOID AT ALL COSTS.

Maria assumes the intellectual capacity of her students are that of high schoolers. Everything you learn is from the book or articles because she has no industry experience. She is nice, but she developed this class around memorizing specific facts about companies rather than understanding retail as a whole. MKT 640 could be amazing with a new prof

maria is the worst.  she grades participation on a curve, so there's no way you'll get an A if you don't participate in the top 10% her tests are way too detailed, and she expects you to remeber the littlest facts.  I don't even see why she teaches this class, seeing as she has never worked retail in her life.

Maria talks to you like you're 5. The info in pretty easy, but she expects you to know little details. All exams are "Which of the following IS NOT true" so you have to think backwards. Lots of short answers on exams, and basically need to memorize the articles she hands out

She is a sweetheart, really nice to everyone. The exam however, is not very easy. Going to every class and take notes as much as possible will help a lot! Anway, she is nice and the contents are updated. Choose it if you like retail!

Previous reviews on Maria are way too harsh.  Yes, the exams are way harder than expected, but this is not an intro level course.  Maria is always available to help outside of class and truly values each and every one of her students.  Although some articles may be outdated, the common theme's are still applicable today.

This class is not academically useful.  The professor regurgitates innocuous facts relating to retail rather than information regarding retail management.  The tests are savage in making sure you memorized these facts.  Professor is much more concerned about you memorizing her stuff than learning.  Not recommend to anyone outside retail major.

Way too many notes and details that are all tested on the test. Surprisingly, the tests are hard too and not because of the material but because of how detaily they are. Participation is ridicilous! To get your points you really have to always talk.
